awd_titl_txt: Large Scale Geometry, Topology, and Rigidity in Geometric   Group Theory
awd_abstract_narration: 9704640  Farb       Farb's project is in the area of geometric group theory.  A new  geometric/topological approach to rigidity questions for lattices in  semisimple Lie groups, generalizing Mostow rigidity, has been developed  by several authors, including Farb.  He plans to continue his work with  L. Mosher in bringing these new ideas and themes to bear on  understanding quasi-isometries of broader classes of groups arising in  combinatorial group theory.  He will also work on characterizing a  broad class of finitely generated groups by certain dynamics they  exhibit.  Finally, Farb will study the geometry of deformation spaces  of discrete subgroups of rank-one Lie groups over local fields.       Geometric group theory is a mixture of geometry, topology, algebra,   and algorithms.  Farb's project in this area is an attempt to understand   the relationship between the symmetries exhibited by a space and its  geometric structure on very large scales.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
